sentences.en: American children did less well in math than their peers in Japan.
sentences.cn: 美国儿童的数学成绩不如日本的同龄儿童。

sentences.en: Furthermore, there is a marked absence of peer pressure here, which would make itself palpably felt when such anti - social conduct occurs.
sentences.cn: 再者, 本地明显缺乏同辈人之间的压力, 致使不良行为发生时,众人浑然不觉其不妥.

sentences.en: He had to peer at his book because the room was dark.
sentences.cn: 因为房间里很暗,他看书时可费劲了.

sentences.en: he is a goalkeeper without peer.
sentences.cn: 他是一个无与伦比的守门员。

sentences.en: He was made a life peer in 1991.
sentences.cn: 他于1991年被封为终身贵族。

sentences.en: He was peering through the wet windscreen at the cars ahead.
sentences.cn: 他正费力地透过淋湿的风挡盯视着前方的汽车。

sentences.en: He was temporarily deprived of the privileges of a peer.
sentences.cn: 他的贵族权力暂被剥夺.

sentences.en: He was valued by both his peer and his superiors.
sentences.cn: 他的同级和上级都很器重他.

sentences.en: He watched the Customs official peer into the driver's window.
sentences.cn: 他看见海关官员透过驾驶座车窗仔细地往里看。

sentences.en: I had been peering at a computer print-out that made no sense at all.
sentences.cn: 我一直在费力地看一份不知所云的电脑打印稿。

sentences.en: In case of peer pressure, just say NO!
sentences.cn: 哪怕处于同龄人的压力下, 也只能说不!

sentences.en: Kennicott stooped to peer through the windows.
sentences.cn: 肯尼科特弯下身来,往窗外看了一眼.

sentences.en: Lord Swan was made a life peer in 1981.
sentences.cn: 斯旺勋爵于1981年受封终身贵族。

sentences.en: Naomi admits that it was peer pressure to be "cool" that drove her into having sex early.
sentences.cn: 娜奥米承认是“装酷”的同辈压力让她过早有了性体验。

sentences.en: Philippa peered into the darkness.
sentences.cn: 菲莉帕凝视着暗处。

sentences.en: She gets on well with her peer group.
sentences.cn: 她和同龄人相处融洽。

sentences.en: She leaned her bike against the stone wall and stood on tiptoe to peer over it.
sentences.cn: 她把自行车斜靠在石墙上，踮起脚往墙内张望。

sentences.en: Staff members are trained by their peers.
sentences.cn: 员工由同事培训。

sentences.en: The market people peer at him from their booths and stalls.
sentences.cn: 集市上的人从他们的货棚和摊子里凝视着他.

sentences.en: The queen created him a peer.
sentences.cn: 女王封他为贵族.

sentences.en: Their curtains are perpetually drawn , so a passerby cannot peer inside.
sentences.cn: 他们的窗帘遮得严严实实,外人难以看清内情.

words.tran_cn: 无与伦比的；出类拔萃的；无比的
（全体）贵族；贵族地位；贵族阶级
有爵位的妇女；贵族夫人
窥视；慢慢露出，出现；吱吱叫

phrases.tran_cn: 无与伦比的，无可匹敌的

trans.tran_cn: 同辈，同等的人，贵族，同伴，伙伴
trans.tran_en: your peers are the people who are the same age as you, or who have the same type of job, social class etc
to look very carefully at something, especially because you are having difficulty seeing it

trans.tran_cn: 凝视，盯着看，隐退，若隐若现，同等，比得上
trans.tran_en: If you peer at something, you look at it very hard, usually because it is difficult to see clearly
